conclusion: The problem involves analyzing forces on two rods on inclined rails in a magnetic field to determine the speed of rod b when certain conditions are met.
The total resistance in the circuit is calculated as R_total = R + R = 2R = 0.2 Ω.
Using the power dissipated in rod a (Q_a = I^2 R_a), the current is calculated as I = √(Q_a / R_a) = √(0.12 / 0.1) ≈ 1.1 A.
The magnetic force on each rod is determined as F_B = BIL, where B = 0.2 T, I ≈ 1.1 A, and L = 0.5 m.
The magnetic force on rod a is calculated as F_Ba = 0.2 × 1.1 × 0.5 = 0.11 N.
The component of gravitational force down the plane for rod a is calculated as m_a g sin θ = 0.3 × 10 × sin(30°) = 1.5 N.
The net force on rod a is calculated as F_net,a = F - m_a g sin θ - F_Ba = 2 - 1.5 - 0.11 = 0.39 N.
The acceleration of rod a is determined as a_a = F_net,a / m_a = 0.39 / 0.3 = 1.3 m/s².
The magnetic force on rod b is calculated as F_Bb = 0.2 × 1.1 × 0.5 = 0.11 N.
The component of gravitational force down the plane for rod b is calculated as m_b g sin θ = 0.1 × 10 × sin(30°) = 0.5 N.
The net force on rod b is calculated as F_net,b = m_b g sin θ + F_Bb = 0.5 + 0.11 = 0.61 N.
The acceleration of rod b is determined as a_b = F_net,b / m_b = 0.61 / 0.1 = 6.1 m/s².
Using the relationship between forces and velocities, the velocity of rod b is calculated as v_b = (F_Bb / (m_b g sin θ)) × v_a = (0.11 / 0.5) × 1 = 0.22 m/s.
